title: Track Premiere: Thousand Mile Channel – Invented Mountains
body:
[**Housewarming Records**](http://housewarmingrecords.bandcamp.com/) have been on something of a roll in the last few months. Releases for [**Wealth**](http://wealthmusic.bandcamp.com) and [**War Mothers**](http://housewarmingrecords.bandcamp.com/album/trouble-b-w-i-wish-you-were-a-monster) have both been on the radars of the kids at [**Crack In The Road**](http://www.facebook.com/crackintheroad), and rightly so, both are great releases for a label that’s just starting to get its feet off the ground. Their next release is by [**Thousand Mile Channel**](http://www.facebook.com/pages/Thousand-Mile-Channel/104426779652789), a bedroom producer currently pursuing a film education in _Austin, Tx_. **Thousand Mile Channel** acts as James Lambrecht’s housing platform for his various film scores and instrumental work he produces. He creates work with a duel motive, he has one eye on an eventual visual outcome, while also focusing on creating music that can be heard in its own right. His first release on **Housewarming** will be released on July 15. For now here’s a teaser from the EP, _Evanston Collectiv_e, a delicate little instrumental, full of flashes of energy and blissful melodies. The beauty is to imagine the film in your head.

Stream and download the track below.

 [Thousand Mile Channel – Invented Mountains](http://soundcloud.com/crackintheroad/thousand-mile-channel-invented) by [crackintheroad](http://soundcloud.com/crackintheroad)
